article.headline: Miami (Ohio) 65, Kent St. 63
article.story: OXFORD, Ohio (AP) -- Tim Pollitz hit a jumper with two seconds left to give Miami of Ohio a 65-63 win over Kent State on Sunday night. Pollitz had 15 points and seven rebounds for the RedHawks (5-8, 1-0 Mid-American Conference), Nathan Peavy added 17 points and Michael Bramos had a career-high 23. Miami took a 33-30 lead at halftime and had a seven-point advantage with 8:57 remaining before Kent State (7-7, 0-1) scored 13 straight points to take a 55-49 lead with 5:48 left. The RedHawks answered with a 12-6 run that tied the score at 61 with 1:36 remaining. A layup by Haminn Quaintance put the Golden Flashes ahead before Pollitz scored a layup with less than a minute to go, then hit the game-winning jumper. Omni Smith led the Golden Flashes with 13 points and Mike Scott added 12 points and five rebounds. Isaac Knight had eight rebounds. Miami shot 48 percent (24-of-50), while Kent State shot about 38 percent (23-of-61).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
